alert.note: Alert for Richland; Sargent (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 30 at 8:10PM CDT by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Otter Tail, northwestern Grant, Wilkin, Richland and east central Sargent Counties through 845 PM CDT... At 810 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms capable of producing a landspout along a line extending from near Wyndmere to Wahpeton to near Nashua. Movement was northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts, wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph, and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Wahpeton, Breckenridge and Dwight around 815 PM CDT. Brushvale around 820 PM CDT. Barney and Kent around 830 PM CDT. Western around 835 PM CDT. Fergus Falls around 845 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Fergus Falls Airport. This includes the following highways... Interstate 29 between mile markers 7 and 36. Interstate 94 in Minnesota between mile markers 41 and 55. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. This type of funnel cloud is harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service.
